title: Tonight's dinner: Pappardelle with shallots, cream and crunchy breadcrumbs
text:
The best pasta dishes are often the simplest. Garlic, chilli and anchovy fried in olive oil. A little chopped fresh tomato and basil. Courgettes cooked slowly in butter until they fall apart. It's why they make the best midweek suppers. A handful of ingredients, a few minutes prep, and the result — the kind of truly satisfying dinner which I always find myself "accidentally" making slightly too much of, and eating the leftovers standing over the hob, straight from the pan.

This dish requires no real chopping or prep, just a bit of patience while you wait for the shallots to get really soft and golden. I'd happily chuck crispy fried breadcrumbs on most things to be honest but they work particularly...
